intro: Chaetobromus dregeanus, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
